content: Good old rpg game üéÆ üëå üëè üôå
Just downloaded the game I will let you know how I like it later.

So, I can tell that this game was made using RPG Maker, because I have RPG Maker FES on my DS. I'd like to know which one, because it seems to have more materials for game-making than FES does. It's truly an impressive game, and I'm not just saying that because it's Yuri. One thing I noticed, though, is that at equipment shops the items "Equipped" and in "Possession" aren't accurately reflected; they always show 0. I can't increase or decrease the amount of gear I want to buy, either.

Easily the best RPGMaker game I've come across on Android. On par with anything Kemco makes. Only cons, I'd say, are the touch controls pop up while using a gamepad occasionally - even after minimizing them, and that the environment isn't as interactive as I'd like (such as searching drawers or reading signs).
This is hidden gem on google playstore. The story is the best. I'm going to buy another of your game, Joshua Keith.
It was surprisingly really really good!!! Amazing actually. Is there going to be a Knight Bewitched 2? Why isn't it the second game on when on my old phone I can find it?
Ending was short, so was gameplay, however, over all, it was fun!!!
Fun little RPG. Great story line. Challenging and tough at times but nothing too hard. Wish it was a little longer but other than that really, really well done.
Great casual JRPG style game. Around 8-15 hours gameplay. Definitely worth the money. Captivating story line. Looking forward to play other games from JK
Was overcharged. No in game help for refund.
replyContent: Hi mark! Sorry to hear about this. I believe I communicated with you via email that I could easily refund your purchase with your order number, but as of now I haven't received that info from you. As a developer, I do *not* control payment processing, so I don't know why this happened, but i can issue refunds.

content: Solid game, cool story.

A masterpiece... brings back memories of playing the original final fantasy on NES, only better in every (graphics, controls, mechanics, fun, replayability etc..) aspect. The story is actually fun and the quirky quips will have you giggling. Well worth the $... a bargain to say the least, so much so I've purchased the rest of the series and have not been disappointed, in fact each one highlights the essence of RPG's best elements evolving from the 80's and leaves you wanting more. Two Thumbs up!
lovely game
Never played it. If you're like me and didn't pay attention when downloading, this is a lesbian love story, so just be aware
A bite-sized RPG adventure. Charming cast, good humor throughout, standard gameplay. I am leaving this review since the dog asked me to, 5 stars from a longtime RPG fan!
replyContent: Thanks a bunch for the review Alice! I have a sequel out (titled Knight Bewitched 2) that's available now if you're interested. It'll go on sale later this month.

content: Great RPG games. If you favorite in classic JRPG like dragon quest,final fantasy, etc. you will love this game. although controlling is a bit hard but not really a problem, story is great. but I love fighting mechanic that you have to choose your gear wisely coz many skill is depend on your gear (good job DEV) at last, I need to say thanks to DEV to make a wonderful game (I'll try other games later) I strongly recommend everyone who love indy JRPG (such as KEMCO fans) worth all your money
replyContent: Thanks you for the review! I hope I can improve the controls for my next release. Let me know if you play any of my other games and run into any problems!

content: The story was enjoyable, and the side quests was fun.
replyContent: Thank you for the review Mark. I have a sequel out (titled Knight Bewitched 2) that I'm sure you'll enjoy (if you haven't alraedy!). It's available on the Play Store now, but it'll go on discount later this month too. Have a great day!

content: Well Rounded Game, controls can be meh.
Good pley
replyContent: thenk

content: The controls. I tap on direction and will go go several steps. Same in the invintory more.. click down once and it will put me on "end game" Being in towns seem to work fine.
replyContent: Hey, thanks for the feedback! Edit: thanks for the update. That level of sensitivity in menus is definitely not normal. I'll continue looking into this and update again once I find a solution.

content: Glitched after meeting king in cell block bottom left corner got stuck by boxes an the ui was stuck on left an could not press anything els an had to close app without been able to save.... Ima give it another go just hope doesn't happen again so seems to be a ui problem keeps freezing on me...

I'm enjoying it! Though the real reason I bought the game is that I saw that the game is about GL plus it is a jrpg which I really love playing. I got worries about the dpad since it is somehow hard to use (maybe because I have a wide phone) plus the quest thing. I hope it will be written on the map on where to go (gaining access of the map is a good thing). Overall, I really like it! Kudos! Edit: And please make more of these GL content rpg. Thank you for creating such gem.
replyContent: Thank you for the review! Sorry about the controls - they've been a constant struggle for me to nail down. The map unfortunately won't point out landmarks, but a free mini guide with a full map layout is available online on my website, jkgames.net. Let me know if you run into any problems! I am working on another GL rpg :)

content: Starts off as a great rendition of the genre. But, it's buggy! Several times I've used potions or spells and they haven't done anything but the item was used or MP lost. The lack of quest tracker (you get a basic one eventually) or any maps makes life awkward and the "30g were found" type grammatical errors are annoying. Controls aren't the best either, the D-Pad would be better if it was floating and the way menus are navigated needs some fine tuning too.

Love it but I have a glitch that ended my game. In Cape town after you are given the rafts, instead of taking them right away I ventured south out of town to level up but upon returning to Cape Town I cant interact with the rafts. Only had one save file so it seems like its game over? HELP! Love the game and would hate to stop playing
replyContent: Heya! After you defeat the cultists in Cape Town and finish that interaction, a raft should automatically appear outside on the World Map, right next to where Cape Town is. You're never actually supposed to interact with the rafts in Cape Town itself. If a raft *didn't* appear on the World Map after killing the cultists, let me know!

content: Honestly didn't finish it. lost interest for some reason. its a legit game though.
replyContent:
Hey, I appreciate the honesty, especially when it's paired with a review :)

Have a great week!

content: Good story line. Dialogue wasn't excessive, so it didn't take away from the gameplay experience. Lots of cool hidden areas, and side quests were relevant to the main game. A couple bucks is a decent price for such a cool game. The one suggestion I would make is to either make the D-Pad larger as the natural range of the thumb is outside those buttons. Makes it a little frustrating to move around. Or make an option to change to a joystick type control.
replyContent: Thanks for the review and the suggestions! When I was first revamping the controls, I actually tried a joystick setup first. I ended up switching to a traditional DPad setup because joystick controls made menu navigation much more difficult. I may look into making it an option (alongside definitely making the DPad bigger) for my next game release.

content: Got lost after not playing a few weeks and lost interest. Boring
Updating my comment !!! This a very nice rpg enjoying all the way thanks for fixing on screen controls they work beautiful!!!!! Looking forward for your other games good work!!!!
Pretty fun old school style RPG

Hidden little gem of a game/developer. I almost feel bad for having bought it on sale! Great old-school JRPG that hits the mark. Balanced difficulty except when I had some issues with the puzzles, but that's just because they're not my fort√©. I had a legit chuckle at some of the banter between the characters and the modern cultural references. Looking forward to trying your other games! By the way... as a gaymer lass, Yuri is always welcome in my RPGs. Cheers!
replyContent: Thanks a bunch for the review, glad you enjoyed it! I'm currently developing Knight Bewitched 2 (same graphics, old and new heroes), planning for mobile release late fall~early winter. Stay tuned, and have a great day!

content: Its great, the story are quite nice, and that easter egg are awesome lol, but the story feels a bit short, is there any continuation on this series?
replyContent: Thanks a bunch for the review! Yeah, there are three other games that take place in the same world - Black Dungeon, Knight of Heaven and Knight Eternal. I'm also working on a direct sequel, Knight Bewitched 2, that'll be out later this year. Have a great day!

content: Amazing game! Great story and so fun to play! I can't wait for the sequel! If you are hesitating downloading and playing this game. Don't. If you like RPGs don't think twice. Download and play this game! My compliments to the programmer!!!!
replyContent: Thanks a bunch for the review, appreciate it!

content: Awesome game! Had a blast!
replyContent: Glad you had fun! Thanks for the review!

content: Great game!
replyContent: Thanks for the review, appreciate it :)

content: Nice old school rpg with a surprisingly good story. 5/5 for story and gameplay but could do with better, adjustable controls.
replyContent: Thanks for the review! 100% agreed on the controls, will hopefully have a better control setup for Knight Bewitched 2!

content: This game was quite fun & kept me engaged. The secret boss is alot of fun to try & defeat. Look forward to more games.
replyContent: Thanks a bunch for the review! There are 3 more games in the series and a direct sequel, Knight Bewitched 2, coming out later this year. Have a great day!

content: This is an amazing RPG! I wasn't expecting this quality of characters developement! I love everything i this game and it's funny ;) That potty village haha!
replyContent: Thanks for the review! Currently working on a direct sequel. Be sure to check out my other games if you haven't already. Have a great day!

content: Thank you for this game, and answering my email when I was stuck (although it turned out I enter the wrong place). It's beyond my expectation! The control feels awkward at first, but I got used to it. Love the graphic, and the story is nice, with enough conversation. Overall, it's a fun eperience!
replyContent: Thanks for the review! Sorry about the controls - hoping to set up a better control scheme for Knight Bewitched 2. Check out my other games if you haven't already! Have a great day!

content: Fun

I love this style of game and this was no disappointment. I played on the second hardest difficulty and it took about 16 hours to complete. I only picked this up because it was on sale but it would have been worth it. Worked well using a bluetooth controller. It was well written--I actually laughed at some parts, especially the pottery part.
replyContent: Thanks for the review! I'm working on a direct sequel as we speak. Be sure to check out my other games if you haven't already! Have a great day!

content: Great as always, glad to see a developer out there still working on great RPGs that aren't 3D or multiplayer. Great story, great system, great job. Love it.
replyContent: Thanks for the kind review, appreciate it! I'm working on Knight Bewitched 2 right now so keep an eye out. I have quite a few other 2D RPGs that take place in the same world (albeit with different graphics), check them out if you get the chance!

content: 15 hours of great game play! I bought this on a whim so I wasn't expecting much but I got hooked. Super fun, great story. Can't wait for the sequel!
replyContent: Thanks a bunch for the review! Working on the sequel right now, hoping to have it released on PC sometime early fall and Android shortly after that. Have a great day!

content: I really enjoyed playing this game. Tho I hope it has option for the controller. Maybe joystick type controller or tap-to-move?
replyContent: Thanks for the review! Knight Bewitched (and all of my other games, check them out!) does have partial controller support. Joystick-type controls are a popular request too and I'll be working on implementing that for my next game too. Have a great day!

content: Loved it!!!! TY
replyContent: NP! Be sure to check out my other games if you haven't already! Have a great day!

content: The game is awesome but it will be nice to have a mini map in other places and not only in the world map. A journal will be great so u dont get lost when u havent played for days and a joystick instead of buttons is a lot more easy to move than buttons. Despite that i love the game really nice work and i hope to see more of ur games. Keep up the good work!!!
replyContent: Thanks for the reviews and your suggestions. There actually is a journal item you can check (it's in your key items list) that can help guide you, but I'll be implementing a better one (and better controls) for my next game. Check out my other games if you get the chance! Have a great day!

content: Good golly I am enjoying this game. I grew up as a jrpg junkie through the eighties till now and breathe a little more easy knowing that your scratching that itch that is getting increasingly harder to itch. Thanks and keep up the good work.
replyContent: Thanks a bunch for your review! Let me know if you have any suggestions, and be sure to check out my other games if you get the chance. Most of them take place in the same world as Knight Bewitched. Have a great day!

content: I love this game it reminds of the Gameboy games I grew up with definitely 5 starsüåü
replyContent: Heya, thanks for the kind review! Be sure to check out my other games if you get the chance. I've got a couple, called Knight of Heaven and Knight Eternal, that have graphics just like some classic Gameboy RPGs. Have a great day!

content: Has far exceeded my expectations. Of particular note are the first person monster battling graphics and artwork. The story is well written, at a sophisticated level, without extraneous verbage. I will be looking forward to the sequels. Any idea as to expected release on those? Update edit: My initial review was based on a few hours into the game. I have since completed the game, and am boosting everything I have said ten-fold. A lot of quality work went into this game. Download and play now.
replyContent: Hey, thanks for the review! I actually have two other games that are part of what I call the "Knights of Ambrose saga": The Black Dungeon RPG and Knight of Heaven: Finding Light. They're not direct sequels, but Knight of Heaven features many of the same characters and takes place 10 years after Knight Bewitched. Check them out!

content: The characters are very likeable. You really pick up on the emotion throughout. I feel like I'm playing an anime Final Fantasy. Very enjoyable.
replyContent: Heya, thanks for the review! I have a few other games available that take place in the same universe (though with a different graphics style). I'm also working on a direct sequel. Let me know if you have any suggestions!

content: Love this game, but keep crashing every so often , before or after battles and when u go in or out towns/dungeons
replyContent: Heya! Thanks for the feedback. Sorry to hear about the crashing. I received a similar report from someone using a Galaxy Note 5 with one of my other games, so I'm wondering if it's a compatibility issue with older Galaxy Notes. I'll be investigating it!

content: Great JRPG. My only gripe is that I'd prefer an analog over dpad.

Not gona lie, came here because of the yuri, but wow the game itself is satisfying and makes me happy! Classic jrpg, great characters with their hi-res image, funny conversations, nice bgm, great story and plot, overall a solid recommendation. Though is there a way to sync the save data so we can continue if we change gadget? That'll be neat, especially now that I just changed phone and I can't find the obb/save data to transfer. A little help pretty please?
So far I enjoy it.

Good old fashioned JRPG! I know some people aren't really into these anymore, as the market has been flooded, but I really think this one got it right! Playing in the hard difficulty, and the balance feels about perfect! I like that there are collectables, but nothing too hard to find (so far). I'm only a couple of hours in, but I know I'm going to enjoy the experience!
replyContent: Thanks for the review! Let me know if you run into any problems, and be sure to check out my other games if you enjoy this one!

content: Fun game, simple to learn, similar to older final fantasy games. Only issue I had was sometimes the enemy health bar was underneath my player names which made it difficult to see how much health they had remaining.
replyContent: Hey, thanks for the review! And thanks for letting me know about the health bar problem. I'll look into fixing that next time I release an update. Be sure to check out my other games!

content: Fun dialogue. The very classic RPG! So if you're fun of those games you will find yourself home here. The combat system is intuitive, graphics are cute. It also supports controller. Overall lot of fun and worth the price.
replyContent: Thanks for the review, I really appreciate it!

content: Another gem from a top developer!
replyContent: Thanks for the support! Let me know if you run into any other problems!

content: Getting the bundle on steam for Christmas, but knight bewitched is my fav of the bunch so I had to have it on my phone too. (: great art, music, and characters. And fun gameplay to boot; looking forward to playing the rest! And to all your future projects! ‚òÜ
replyContent: Thanks for your support, I really appreciate it :)

content: A very fun classic styled RPG. Very good story character development,etc. Only complaint is how it'll randomly crash. As long as you save often it's not a big deal though. Please continue to make more games!
Really like it. Reminds me of my old school rpg days. My only con is the length of the game. I hope one day you release one that is twice as long, maybe 15-25 hr adventure.
replyContent: Thanks for the review! Most of my games float around 8-16 hours of gameplay depending on playstyle. I agree that that's a little short for the average RPG, but it's my personal development style, and I tend to balance it with a lower pricetag. Let me know if you run into any problems!

content: Loved it, wish a walk through was available but I completed nonetheless. Really really liked it though

Thanks for the changes. That's much better. I haven't played much of the game but have gladly upped my rating to 4 stars. I wish there were more developers like you who listen to customer feedback and are prepared to make changes based on that feedback.
replyContent: Thanks for the review! I actually agree with you on the lighting effects. They were designed with PCs in mind, which is why I had to make them optional for the Android release. Edit: Update should be available now. The D-Pad is slightly larger. I tend to update the controls in small increments so let me know if they feel any better or not.

content: I like this game that has character,good story and retro graphics that remind me of the good ol' SNES Days.Great Job Development Team üòÄ

Enjoyed this game a lot, only took me 3 days to beat it, including all the side quests and the "hardest boss" felt it was well worth the $2. Gj guys. A side note: The update mentioned you guys fixed the dialogue getting cut off on Some devices. I just thought I'd mention that I have a S7-edge, and I couldn't see all the dialogue neer the end of the game. This could still use more tweaking. And also a suggestion, it would be nice to have a way to scroll back through the dialogue. Thanks
replyContent: Hey, thanks for the report and the suggestion. I'll have another small dialogue tweak out later this afternoon. Glad you enjoyed the game!

content: Very fun rpg love the classic feel. Wish i could play your next game but it isnt compatible with my phone yet.
replyContent: Hey! I updated the device list for The Black Dungeon so you should be able to download it. However, I will mention it might run a little slower/choppy on your device as the device requirements are a little higher than Knight Bewitched. Let me know if you have any problems. Sorry for taking so long to get back to you!

content: Great game. It seems i got a wrong turn, i already played finding light just to know this is the story before finding light. I'll buy the next one again later. It is easy to understand the game so i can play it in one go without repeated again and again to open all the secret area such as Ogopogo, Strief, and the secret tree.
Loved the game, the story and the gameplay were amazing, the controls as well, loved the small teaser at the end. Can't wait for a part two if there will ever be one, hope there will be
replyContent: The Black Dungeon RPG and Knight of Heaven: Finding light are the next two games in the series. Black Dungeon features mostly new characters while Knight of Heaven has a different look, but lots of familiar faces. Check them out if you get a chance!

content: I really liked this game but got a new phone and lost progress can't be bothered grinding through from the start again. Simple enough Rpg to play. Needs a bit of grinding to keep your party competitive with the difficulty curve.
Love this game! Fun dialogue, beautiful old school graphics, greatly dawn unit art, and supremely enjoyable! Worth more than what it is charging!
Good jrpg and nice challange
A pleasing balance of story, exploring, and fighting. I wish all games were this entertaining.
Amazingly quick response and bug fix. I was able to finish the game now without any other issues. Definitely deserves 5 stars.
replyContent: Hey Shawty, do you happen to remember when exactly the error ocurred (before/during/after the fight) and what else the error said (usually there's something listed after "TypeError". Edit: Update should be live and ready to go. Let me know if you have any other problems!

content: Traditional rpg experience, very good and straightforward. Overall an incredibly worthwhile purchase. The combat system is pretty easy to understand, occasionally funny dialogue. Do get some occasional slowdown and lag in battles, and sometimes words in npc dialogue boxes go off screen. I've been searching for sometime for a new rpg on my phone, and this is definitely scratching the itch. Initial impressions are very good, will update review when I finish my playthrough.
GREAT
I've been playing this game off and on (9 hours total so far) I like these developers because they actually listen and update the game. üòÄ 5 stars all the way.

Great game if you are a fan of old Final Fantasy style RPGs. I just completed the game and I loved it! I agree that the controls can use some work but that doesn't take much away from the game. Great game play, nice story and quite funny with breaking the 4th wall. Hope to see a sequel some day.
replyContent: Thanks for the review! Knight Bewitched actually does have a sequel - Knight of Heaven: Finding Light. It's a bit different (grayscale gameboy-style graphics), but takes place ten years after Knight Bewitched and has many recurring characters, Stray being a big one and Malady as well. Have a great day!

content: text mostly fits in boxes but does have occasional issues. controls are good if a little touchy. 5 stars regardless because it's very fun, good humor, and worth completing
replyContent: Thanks for the review :) If you remember at all, where there any specific areas the text got cut off in? I believe having an enlarged font size in your phone's Accessibility Settings can cause cut-offs, but it's possible a few spots could get cut off regardless.

content: Great game. Good story... First class

I havent made it far but I want to leave a review to support the developer. Theres a lot of great stuff going on here, especially the dialogue, which doesnt suffer the way so many android games do. As others have said the controls are awkward but its not a huge problem. Definitely give this one a try if you like DQ or FF style JRPGs.
replyContent: Thanks for the kind review! Hope you enjoy the rest of the game!

content: I really enjoy this game so far, although I just started playing it. If you enjoy games like Golden Sun, Dragon Warrior or Dragon Quest, and the Final Fantasy series and other JRPGs then you will love this. It has good graphics, even during the story with the animations when you see the characters talking. Also, the developer has been great about giving me support to get me started in the game.
replyContent: Thanks a bunch! If you run into any more issues or have suggestions, you know who to talk to. Have a great day!

content: feels like persona 5 with thee combat system. graphics feed my nostalgia. controls are okay mostly complaining about the spacing between the arrows i feel like the arrow should be closer. everything else is fine. edit: i now think the arrow spacing is well done and shouldn't be changed
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback. Do you feel like the arrows should be spaced out a bit more or less?

Edit: released an update that makes the buttons bigger and a bit closer together. Hope this helps!

content: I wish there was a way you can keep playing the game even after you beat the game you play into the part where you and gwendolyn are already married.
A wonderful rpg that calls back to classic jrpgs but still feels fresh all the same. Tells a great story and romance that feels authentic and not forced. Awesome game for the price!

love this game only issue I have is some of the story when reading it is not always in the boxes it runs off and I try to make out what is says but it would be better if it was all there anyone else having this issue its runs off the screen almost every scene thank you I really do like this game so please fix it
replyContent: Thanks for the update. I'll look into why this could happen on your device and hopefully have an update out soon. Edit: Would you mind sending an email to me at Jkweath@gmail.com with a screenshot of the game running? Preferably a screenshot showing the text cut-off problem. You can screenshot by holding the volume down and power key for 2 seconds.

content: Controls are too clunky for my liking. A virtual D-pad would have been preferred.
replyContent: Sorry about the clunky controls. I actually agree that a virtual DPad that most mobile games have would be better - I'll be working on implementing that instead of on-screen buttons, but it'll take awhile unfortunately. Anyway, Thanks for the feedback!

content: Awesome man thank you!
replyContent:
Thanks for the review and feedback. I just noticed the button flickering you mentioned and I'll work on fixing this ASAP.
Edit: Should be fixed now!
